required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Immune Response to Influenza Vaccine in ESRD Patients
clinical_study.official_title: Immune Response to Influenza Vaccination in ESRD Patients Undergoing Hemodialysis vs. Hemodiafiltration

brief_summary.textblock: On-line hemodiafiltration (HDF) clears more azotaemic toxins compared to high-flux hemodialysis (HD). The response to vaccination is impaired in dialysis patients. We aimed to study the immune responses to influenza vaccine in dialysis patients treated by HDF vs. HD.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: A prospective cohort study in chronic dialysis patients during the 2016 and 2017 influenza seasons All participants received a single standard dose of trivalent influenza vaccine The elicited humoral immune response by hemagglutination inhibition test, and cell-mediated immune response by enumeration of lymphocyte cellular markers and proliferation assays are studied.

primary_outcome.measure: measurement antibody titers, determined by hemagglutination inhibition (HI) assay.
primary_outcome.description: measurement antibody titers, determined by hemagglutination inhibition (HI) assay.

secondary_outcome.measure: measurement T cell subpopulations, determined by flow cytometer AND cell proliferation assay after stimulated with influenza viruses.
secondary_outcome.description: measurement T cell subpopulations, determined by flow cytometer AND cell proliferation assay after stimulated with influenza viruses.

arm_group.description: ESRD patients treated by on-line hemodiafiltration

intervention.description: A single standard dose of inactivated trivalent influenza vaccine: Influvac® vaccines (Abbott, the Netherlands), intramuscularly.
intervention.other_name: A single standard dose of inactivated trivalent influenza vaccine: Influvac® vaccines (Abbott, the Netherlands), intramuscularly.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- ESRD patients aged 18 years or older, who had been treated for more than one month of either thrice weekly on-line hemodiafiltration (HDF) or conventional high flux hemodialysis (HD), with a session dialyzer urea clearance (Kt/V urea) of 1.2 and greater, with a convection volume target of 20 L/session for the HDF group
Exclusion Criteria:
- Had received any vaccination within the previous four weeks, or influenza vaccination within six months
- Patient who reported upper respiratory tract symptoms within three days prior to the study vaccination
- A history of allergy to influenza vaccine or egg
- Thrombocytopenia
- In receipt of immunosuppressant medications, chemotherapy, or had immunodeficiency
